intro: Sicyos pachycarpus, commonly known as the giant buckler-egg, is a member of the葫芦科 (Cucurbitaceae) family. It is a sprawling perennial vine characterized by its large, lobed leaves and showy yellow flowers. The plant produces thick, fleshy fruits that are typically green when mature. Native to tropical and subtropical regions, it thrives in warm, humid climates. Its botanical features make it a notable species for both ornamental and ecological purposes.
